page.title: 16 GETTING TO SCHOOL
page.content: Most children travel to school by bus. Some use taxis and private cars. The buses travel along very complicated routes because the roads are narrow and the hills are steep. Children live in lonely places and go to seven different schools. Three bus companies do all the official transport. Two use coaches which cannot travel far from the main road, (A39). The third uses minibuses and a taxi to collect isolated children from the hills. All the buses have to connect with each other so that no one is late for school. The minibuses are garaged at{Withycombe}and travel over 800 miles a week, using 54 gallons of fuel. This is a lot because they travel slowly on rough roads. {Roadwater}is the meeting point for most of the transport and it is a very busy village between 8 and 8.30a.m.
